Sentencas: The direct conversion of coal to heat and electricity by a hybrid direct carbon fuel cell (HDCFC) is a highly efficient and cleaner technology than the conventional combustion power plants.
Titulo: Cathode-supported hybrid direct carbon fuel cells

Sentencas: HDCFC is defined as a combination of solid oxide fuel cell and molten carbonate fuel cell.
Titulo: Cathode-supported hybrid direct carbon fuel cells

Sentencas: This work investigates cathode-supported cells as an alternative configuration for HDCFC, with better catalytic activity and performance.
Titulo: Cathode-supported hybrid direct carbon fuel cells

Sentencas: This study aims to define the best processing route to manufacture highly efficient cathode-supported cells based on La0.75Sr0.25MnO3/yttria-stabilized zirconia infiltrated backbones.
Titulo: Cathode-supported hybrid direct carbon fuel cells

Sentencas: The challenges on the development of high-performance backbones are discussed.
Titulo: Cathode-supported hybrid direct carbon fuel cells

Sentencas: In this study, cathode supported configuration was confirmed to be more efficient for the oxidation of carbon than anode supported configuration.
Titulo: Cathode-supported hybrid direct carbon fuel cells

Sentencas: The maximum power density of the cathode supported cell increased almost by a factor of two when compared with the anode supported cell.
Titulo: Cathode-supported hybrid direct carbon fuel cells
